content:
Watercolors are such a wonderful medium! I'm happy to help you get started.

Congratulations on getting back into painting and enjoying the outdoors while doing so! That sounds like a lovely way to spend a Sunday afternoon.

For beginners, it's essential to start with good-quality materials that are easy to work with and won't break the bank. Here are some excellent brands and sets to consider:

1. **Winsor & Newton**: A well-known and respected brand in the art world. Their Cotman series is an excellent starter set, offering a range of colors and a great price point.
2. **Daniel Smith**: A popular choice among watercolor artists, Daniel Smith offers a range of sets, including a beginner's Essentials Set that includes 6 tubes of paint and a travel brush.
3. **Holbein**: A Japanese brand known for their light-fast pigments and vibrant colors. Their Watercolor Set is a great starter kit that includes 12 tubes of paint and a mixing tray.
4. **Schmincke**: A German brand that offers high-quality paints at an affordable price. Their Horadam Aquarellum Set is a great starter kit that includes 12 tubes of paint and a travel brush.

When it comes to sets, look for ones that include:

* A variety of colors (at least 10-12)
* Good-quality brushes (natural or synthetic fibers)
* A mixing tray or palette
* A container or case to store your paints and brushes

Some popular sets for beginners include:

* Winsor & Newton Cotman Watercolors Set (12 tubes, $25-$35)
* Daniel Smith Essentials Set (6 tubes, $25-$35)
* Holbein Watercolor Set (12 tubes, $30-$40)
* Schmincke Horadam Aquarellum Set (12 tubes, $40-$50)

Additionally, consider the following tips when starting out with watercolors:

* Invest in a good-quality watercolor paper (cold press or hot press)
* Start with a limited palette and experiment with mixing colors
* Practice, practice, practice! Watercolors can be unforgiving, but it's all part of the learning process.

I hope this helps you get started on your watercolor journey!
